Owlhawk:  MA'AM YES MA'AM!

--- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@...> wrote:
> Katya smiled. She took some pride in the fact that
> Owlhawk was 
> interested by her teaching.
> 
> Katya: Taking a bondsman is honoring a worthy foe.
> Phelan Kell took 
> Ragnar as a bondsman because he had been an able and
> intelligent 
> warrior, something Phelan knew would serve the
> Wolves. Ragnar served 
> for about two years as a mech technician before he
> was deemed worthy 
> to become a warrior again. The same thing happened
> when he was 
> captured by the Ghost Bears. In short, the bondsman
> serves the 
> bondsmaster and pushes himself to become a warrior
> once more. Does 
> that clear things up, quiaff?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> wrote:
> > Owlhawk:  What's a bondman?
> > 
> > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Katya: Aye... That is one possible weakness...
> Late
> > > Lincoln Osis, the 
> > > last Smoke Jaguar, had won his position as a
> Khan
> > > and then as Ilkhan. 
> > > He was a tactical Genius, but his lack of
> strategic
> > > thinking got his 
> > > Clan wiped out by the Inner Sphere forces.
> However,
> > > we train our 
> > > warriors so that they understand strategies as
> well
> > > as tactics. In 
> > > your case though, I will support you and help
> you
> > > with strategies, and 
> > > I hope so will Ragnar. That man is a
> > > strategic-planner born. He was a 
> > > counselor for many great leaders of Inner Sphere
> > > armies before the 
> > > Bears made him a bondsman.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > wrote:
> > > > Owlhawk listened to this, but his curiosity
> grew
> > > about
> > > > one thing.
> > > > 
> > > > Owlhawk:  But beating my commander in a fight
> > > would
> > > > simply prove I can beat him one on one, what
> would
> > > it
> > > > prove in terms of who is most capable of
> planning
> > > our
> > > > battle strategies?
> > > > 
> > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Katya realized what she had forgotten to
> tell
> > > him.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya: You are right about the challenge.
> Should
> > > you
> > > > > win, you would 
> > > > > prove that you are a better warrior than
> your
> > > > > officer, thus proving 
> > > > > him wrong.
> > > > > 
> > > > > She paused, then started moving back to the
> > > base.
> > > > > She waved him to 
> > > > > follow.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya: Now about the Kerenskys... They are
> the
> > > > > founders of all Clans, 
> > > > > the makers of our society and one of the
> most,
> > > if
> > > > > not the most revered 
> > > > > Bloodline among all Clans. Some of us
> maintain
> > > that
> > > > > our duty as 
> > > > > Warriors is to protect the Inner Sphere. We
> > > oppose
> > > > > the Crusaders 
> > > > > saying it is a desecrated place and that it
> > > deserves
> > > > > only to be 
> > > > > conquered and brought back up into a
> stronger
> > > Clan
> > > > > society. It is all 
> > > > > interpretation of the words of Nicholas
> > > Kerensky,
> > > > > the first Ilkhan, 
> > > > > and it has led many to die, both among and
> > > outside
> > > > > the Clans.
> > > > > 
> > > > > She closed her eyes remembered all too well
> the
> > > two
> > > > > days she had spent 
> > > > > evading the massive ComGuard battlemechs at
> the
> > > > > Great battle of 
> > > > > Tukkayid. She had seen friends die there,
> and
> > > she
> > > > > felt that it was 
> > > > > foolish for such a waste as the invasion.
> > > > >

> > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > wrote:

> > > in

> > > of
> > > > > > > thing that debalances 
> > > > > > > a world's environment needlessly. A
> military
> > > > > > > compound can be built on 
> > > > > > > rock farther away. In that situation,
> when

> > > > > feel

> > > > > > > youmust challenge
